item.title: On Teaching: A Few Useful Analogies | JONATHAN DINU
item.description: Over the years I have been teaching (and learning), I have often used a few analogies to help me organize my thoughts when approaching a new subject or curriculum. I have been very fortunate while building Zipfian Academy to work with great students and teachers alike from whom I have learned immensely, and many of the formalisms contained here are borne out of that time.

item.title: K-Nearest Neighbors ‚Äì Running on Numbers
item.description: Pitch tunneling is the art of deception. It‚Äôs a pitcher‚Äôs ability to make multiple, distinct pitches look identical as they leave the hand. From the batter‚Äôs perspective, two pitches can travel through the same ‚Äútunnel‚Äù partway to the plate before diverging. What looked like a hittable fastball suddenly drops off the table - a devastating curveball for a swinging strike. Effective tunneling neutralizes a batter‚Äôs ability to recognize a pitch, forcing a split-second, and often wrong, decision.

item.title: what's up üóíÔ∏è üíª
item.description: This essay explores what I'll call the "Fancy Rug Effect" - how as means improve, abstract concepts gain value over practical ones. It also examines the corresponding dilemma: developing skills in the abstract increases the temptation to avoid practical problems. While not entirely new [1], hopefully this interpretation makes it more personal and possibly less ...fancy.

item.title: Cesium
Sending Email Correctly in .NET
item.description:
Get 30% off everything on Dometrain: https://dometrain.com/courses/?ref=nick-chapsas&promo=youtube&coupon_code=SUMMER30 Subscribe to my weekly newsletter: https://nickchapsas.com
Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, Dylan Beattie will show you to properly and correctly send emails in .NET. Sending emails is a fundamental feature of almost every application and understanding how to do it properly is one of the most important things you can do to get an edge over other developers.
Subscribe to Dylan Beattie: https://www.youtube.com/dylanbeattie
Workshops: https://bit.ly/nickworkshops
